intro: Ouratea andongensis, commonly known as the Andong ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in white or pale yellow. It typically grows in lowland to montane forests, often in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
